title: Share of ethnic minorities in the China 's minority autonomous regions 2018
summary: This bar chart has 21 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Share of ethnic minorities in each Province on the y axis.
Province Tibet has the highest Share of ethnic minorities and Zhejiang has the lowest Share of ethnic minorities.
There is a difference of 78.24 between the maximum Province Tibet and minimum Province Zhejiang.
min_summary: This bar chart has 21 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Share of ethnic minorities in each Province on the y axis.
The maximum Share of ethnic minorities 90.05 is found at Province Tibet and the minimum is found at Zhejiang where Province is 11.81.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 21 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Share of ethnic minorities in each Province on the y axis.
Province Tibet has the highest Share of ethnic minorities and Zhejiang has the lowest Share of ethnic minorities.
There is a difference of 78.24 between the maximum Province Tibet and minimum Province Zhejiang.
max_summary: This bar chart has 21 columns on the x axis representing Province, and Share of ethnic minorities in each Province on the y axis.
The Share of ethnic minorities is appeared to be the highest at Province Tibet and lowest at Province Zhejiang.
Province Hunan has the second highest value for Share of ethnic minorities.
There is a difference of 78.24 between the maximum Province Tibet and minimum Province Zhejiang.
Share of ethnic minorities at Province Tibet is 90.05 , second place is Hunan at 83.5, and thirdly is Chongqing at 74.39.
The Province Zhejiang tends to be 1.7 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Provinces, we get total 1109.41.
